column2: • Concrete mix design approved by the Superintendent and a registered mix and Material properties meet project specifications
Freq: Prior to start of works
Freq: Prior to start of works
Freq: Prior to start of works
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Is the work area clearly pegged out for line and level?
Freq: Prior to start of works
• Is edging constructed over Pavement layer?
• Where edgings are constructed over pavement layers, bedding shall be provided between the pavement layer and the underside of the edging, or the edging thickened to match the pavement layer.
• Is bedding for footpaths and surfaces compacted to 100mm thickness unless noted otherwise.
• Is bedding for SUPs, bedding compacted to 150mm thick unless noted otherwise.
• Bedding shall be moist but shall have no free water on the surface before concrete is placed

• Is bedding material used for cast in place concrete paving works compacted size 20 mm Class 3 or Class 4 crushed rock or Class 3 or Class 4 crushed concrete, manufactured and supplied in accordance with Sections 812 or 820 respectively.
• Is bedding material for shared use paths compacted size 20 mm Class 3 crushed rock or Class 3 crushed concrete in accordance with Section 812 or 820 respectively, and Section 304.
• Are pavement lots tested for compliance with the specified compaction scale for moisture content no less than 85%
• Is fill material used below bedding tested to Table 204.131 Compaction Requirements
Freq: Prior to start of works
• Have sign post sockets been supplied & placed for erection of permanent signs in the areas to be paved as per VR703.22.
• Relevant permits have been signed and approved.
Freq: Prior to start of works
• Excavation to a total depth of
• Class __ crushed rock or crushed concrete placed?
• Formwork has been installed correctly and sufficiently braced.
• Formwork set out has been done as per latest design drawings and specifications
• Were Construction joints/Expansion Joints/Isolation Joints /or any type of joint as specified in the drawings Installed
• Installations of Cast-Ins/ HD bolts/ Chemical Anchors/Block out Verified/Sockets
• Mesh installed with 40mm top and sides cover and 50 mm Bottom Cover
• Tolerance - As per specifications and Australian Standard
• Steel is free of excess corrosion, loose millings, oil or other contaminants
• Required Connection Details - U Bars/ Z Bars/Cogs/Starter bars Verified
• Correct concrete cover and chairs on sides, bottom and top Verified
• Has steel reinforcement been placed correctly with adequate cover?
• Have tie bars and joints been installed at the correct intervals?
• Pour area is free of loose debris, oils, water
• Have any services/penetrations/blockout located within the Pavements been installed, surveyed and pinned down
• Concrete Testing Lab Representative will be available during concrete pour
• Sufficient vibrators are available during concrete pour
• CYP D&C JV informed of concrete pour date and start time
Freq: Prior to start of Concrete Placement
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Is concrete temperature as per VR703. and not mixed when the air temperature is lower than 5°C or greater than 35°C.
• Is discharge Time 60 minutes unless mix design is approved by Proof Engineer for 90 minutes.
• Is concrete thoroughly compacted and works carried out as per Australian Standard & Project Drawings/ Specifications
• Are concrete samples taken in accordance with 610.16(b).
• Is concrete mixed for not less than a period of three (3) minutes prior to discharge.
• Is the maximum time lag between truck loads on site shall not exceeding 25 minutes if a continuous pour
• A minimum of one of vibrator used at all times while the concreting is in operation
• Were forms/cast in items monitored during the pour.
• Concrete Fall achieved as per latest IFC drawings
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Did concrete achieve the required finish as per specifications
• Are hidden concrete surfaces of concrete paving have a Class 4 surface finish in accordance with AS 3610.
• Curing agent applies as per project specifications
• Concrete reached design strength to strip formwork. (Attach test results)
• Any identified defects after stripping rectified
• Were expansion joints placed at intervals less than 10m.
• As Built Survey completed and report attached.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc):
• Were topsoil placed and compacted on layers not exceeding 150mm in thickness and not exceeding 300mm in width not earlier than 3 days after concrete pour?
• Were the positions of any existing conduits passing under edgings marked by a chase in the edging immediately above the conduit together with a suitable identification mark.
Date NCR closed for this lot
